title: India Now World's 2nd Largest 5G Mobile Market, Surges Past US: Report
content: India has overtaken the US to become the world's second-biggest 5G handset market for the first time, behind China, a report has mentioned.
summary: India has overtaken the US to become the world's second-biggest 5G handset market for the first time, behind China, a report has mentioned.

title: China Firm Launches AI "Life Assistant" That Can Order Food, Hail Taxis
content: The fintech firm backed by Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba has made a foray into products powered by artificial intelligence after announcing a "life assistant" mobile app.
summary: The fintech firm backed by Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba has made a foray into products powered by artificial intelligence after announcing a "life assistant" mobile app.

title: "Died Helpless": Wife Of US Man Whose Liver Was Mistakenly Removed
content: The family of 70-year-old William Bryan accused Dr Thomas Shaknovsky of removing the wrong organ from his body.

title: Opinion: IC 814 Row, And My 1994 Encounter With Terrorist Omar Sheikh
content: The Netflix web series IC 814: The Kandahar Hijack has sparked a controversy over names of a few of the hijackers. But it has taken me back to my chance encounter with Omar Sheikh, one of the three terrorists released after the hijack.

title: "Treated Like Garbage": French Woman On Husband Who Let 50 Men Rape Her

title: 17 Children Die After Fire Rips Through Primary School Hostel In Kenya
content: At least 17 children died after a fire ripped through their primary school dormitory overnight in central Kenya, police said Friday.
summary: At least 17 children died after a fire ripped through their primary school dormitory overnight in central Kenya, police said Friday.

title: Video: Drunk EasyJet Passenger Forces Emergency Landing In Munich
content: An EasyJet flight, bound for Kos International Airport in Greece, was forced to make an emergency landing at Munich International Airport after an allegedly drunk passenger caused midair chaos and terrorised others onboard.
summary: An EasyJet flight, bound for Kos International Airport in Greece, was forced to make an emergency landing at Munich International Airport after an allegedly drunk passenger caused midair chaos and terrorised others onboard.

title: Researchers Find Connection Between Alzheimer's, Night Time Light Pollution
content: A team of US researchers on Friday said that they have found a connection between Alzheimer's disease (AD) and night time light pollution from the outdoors.
summary: A team of US researchers on Friday said that they have found a connection between Alzheimer's disease (AD) and night time light pollution from the outdoors.

title: Muhammad Yunus Says Issues Over Water Treaty With India Must Be Resolved
content: Bangladesh's Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus has said the interim government would pursue with India ways to resolve the differences over the long-pending Teesta water sharing treaty, as delaying it for years serves no purpose for either nation.
summary: Bangladesh's Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus has said the interim government would pursue with India ways to resolve the differences over the long-pending Teesta water sharing treaty, as delaying it for years serves no purpose for either nation.

title: Who Will Win White House Race? "Nostradamus" Of US Polls Tells NDTV...

title: June-August 2024 Were Hottest Summer Months Ever Recorded
content: The 2024 northern summer saw the highest global temperatures ever recorded, beating last year's record and making this year likely Earth's hottest ever, the EU's climate monitor said Friday.
summary: The 2024 northern summer saw the highest global temperatures ever recorded, beating last year's record and making this year likely Earth's hottest ever, the EU's climate monitor said Friday.

title: US Charges 5 Russian Military Officers Over Ukraine Cyberattacks
content: The United States charged five Russian military officers on Thursday for allegedly conducting cyberattacks on civilian infrastructure in Ukraine ahead of the Russian invasion.

title: Blinken May Not Return For Another Term, Wants To Spend Time With Children
content: Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Thursday he hoped to spend more time with his children next year, hinting he would not pursue another term as the top US diplomat.

title: Frozen In Terror: Extremely Well-Preserved Ancient Mummies Found In Iran
content: An ancient salt mine in Iran naturally preserved dead miners for thousands of years in a grisly state - some of them frozen with their arms still raised before being buried alive.
summary: An ancient salt mine in Iran naturally preserved dead miners for thousands of years in a grisly state - some of them frozen with their arms still raised before being buried alive.

title: "Abandon Blind Bias": Hamas Urges US Pressure On Netanyahu For Gaza Deal

title: "Wanted To Play": Roller-Skating Gaza Girl, 10, Killed In Israeli Strike
